summary:

Never mind, I’ll manage. Hopefully. 🤣

Okay but I should have done the other hand before the binoculars though. 😬
Never mind, I’ll manage. Hopefully. 🤣

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

summary: Doctor Who Meets The Muppets! - David Tennant Reprises The Tenth Doctor Live At The O2 AND Duets With Kylie!
title: Doctor Who Meets The Muppets! - David Tennant Reprises The Tenth Doctor Live At The O2 AND Duets With Kylie!
excerpt: David Tennant reprised his role as the Tenth Doctor for one night only last night as he appeared on stage in The Muppets Take The O2...
description:
David Tennant reprised his role as the Tenth Doctor for one night only last night as he appeared on stage in The Muppets Take The O2 for a new sketch of the classic “Pigs In Space.” 

The live event, based on the iconic 1980s TV show, is being performed for the first time outside the USA following three sellout dates at the Hollywood Bowl last year

Kermit the Frog and Miss Piggy lead Gonzo, Fozzie, the Swedish Chef, Animal and the gang as their most sensational, inspirational, celebrational, muppetational, full-length live show comes to Europe for three shows at London’s O2.  The Muppets were joined last night by David, Kylie Minogue, Charles Dance and Kevin Bishop for musical performances, sketches and many, many more extraordinary surprises.

David also joined Kylie and Kermit for a rendition of Rainbow Connection.

!!!

The TARDIS podcast ep 8 The Day Rose Died

Greetings earthlings! This is Time & Relative DISCUSSIONS In Space (TARDIS), a Doctor Who podcast brought to you by the Taylor Network of Podcast.
Join The Captain and his two faithful companions Paul Sherman and Darrell Taylor as we embark on adventures through space and time.

blog.name: talktoten
blog.title: The Doctor
blog.description:
| independent tenth doctor |
open to non-mutuals
roleplay & advice
rules / about

question: ✈ - an eye-opening memory !
answer:
Memory Meme - send one for:   ✈ - an eye-opening memory | accepting

Travel. 

Always, travel. There was a yearning there, some unanswered part of his soul; he had known for many years that he loved it, and his ship, but here, now, with the wood of her beneath his hand … the Doctor ran his fingertips across the wooden doorframe. He listened to his ship, the newly last of her kind, groan as he greeted her. All that death, all that loss - all that guilt suddenly on his shoulders and he came to his ship, after hours of sitting and staring and feeling absolutely nothing, and when he’d got here it hadn’t been quiet. It had been rage, and he’d thrown himself at the console and argued with her that she had to take him back (which was unfair, because she couldn’t - and he knew that she ached in the same way), and when he had exhausted himself he’d sat down, spent, against the inside of the double wooden doors, to swallow thrice and weep anyway, unable to conquer the lump in his throat. What sort of man would he have been, to not cry? 

But he had come back to his ship, and now he was here, and it was done. Though his eyes were wet, he was alone. And for a long moment there he had worried he’d lose the TARDIS, too, but his ship stood in silence with him. He swallowed again, and heard some part of her moan, weak and tired in the same way he was. 

He pulled his hand away and ran it over his face. 

This was his ship. This was the TARDIS. And there were stars still out there, burning bright and fantastic and glorious, and there were things to do, and adventures to be had. And he could do this. The Doctor hoisted himself up on the railing - he would have to change this interface, he didn’t like it anymore; something corally, maybe. The TARDIS would inevitably decide to change as well and surprise him - and there he was, standing. Here, now, with the ship at his fingertips, and all the rest of the universe to explore? 

All the rest of life, all the rest of a world he had just saved, all the rest of the endless forever? 

“Let’s go,” he rasped, voice thick, and worked his way over to the console. “Come on,” he said; the TARDIS had not immediately leaped at the instruction, and it would do them both some good so he roared, a second time, “COME ON!” and the rotor worked itself into life. It was okay. 

It was okay. He could travel. They could travel. The Doctor had his ship, and he would be okay. He was not going to focus on the things he’d lost - what sort of rubbish was that, what sort of idiot spent years lost in the past? An idiot any self-respecting Time Lord would frown upon, was who. He had a space-time machine which would travel anywhere and anywhen (for the most part), who was to say that infinity didn’t have something to offer? His grip fastened on the controls. He sniffed, and swallowed again. 

“A whole universe is out there,” he muttered, mostly to himself: “I can do that.” It was what he’d been doing to begin with. 

No matter what, he realised, then, in that moment - there - no matter what, if he could travel, he could keep going. If he had his ship, he would bounce back. He was not a quitter. Something turned in his stomach when he realised it (guilt, maybe, or anticipation, or both), but he did: this would always keep him going.  

Travel.

Always, travel.

He had a space-time machine which would travel anywhere and anywhen (for the most part), who was to say that infinity didn’t have something to offer? His grip fastened on the controls. He sniffed, and swallowed again. 

“A whole universe is out there,” he muttered, mostly to himself: “I can do that.” It was what he’d been doing to begin with. 

No matter what, he realised, then, in that moment - there - no matter what, if he could travel, he could keep going. If he had his ship, he would bounce back. He was not a quitter. Something turned in his stomach when he realised it (guilt, maybe, or anticipation, or both), but he did: this would always keep him going.  

Travel.

Always, travel.

blog.name: talktoten
blog.title: The Doctor
blog.description:
| independent tenth doctor |
open to non-mutuals
roleplay & advice
rules / about

question: ↕
answer:
Memory Meme - send one for:  ↕ a memory that may or may not have happened | accepting

It was a Sunday, or one of those days on those planets where it was half of a Sunday and half of a Monday put together, but also a bit of Tuesday because time sort of tangoed when it made days on planet Fwa. The point was that it was a sunny day where most of the time, nothing happened (though that was not the case today); more to the point it was one of those times that the Doctor slept peacefully, fueled by the adrenaline of doing something (because he was smack-bang in the middle of solving some problem for some intergalactic company whose employees were being eaten by its less saleable wallflowers, which had also incidentally consumed half of headquarters).

He murmured only once in his sleep, about nothing of any consequence, and when he rolled he woke himself up: the ground was cold beneath him. Something rumbled. He’d fallen quite some distance, it felt like (he was intimately familiar with this feeling, which was not something he had ever set out to be familiar with but it just HAPPENED). There were aches in all the right places. His consciousness was the right amount of half-there. He swallowed, and stretched, and someone took a hold of his hand - their fingers slipped through his. It fit there, their hand. His own fingers felt it out, searching for them - for her - for some proof.  

“Hey,” she whispered, “you need to move. Get up.” 

He vaulted awake and away from the ground in an instant, and his eyes were open but the hand had disappeared, and so had she; the vines of the wallflowers crept ever closer, working hard to swallow the space where the Doctor had been lying, only a second before. He could feel the ghost of her in his hand, still - caught it up with his other, staring. Had that been…? 

A woman - not the same one - careened down the stairs, her hair fly away, her breath ragged. “Oh, thank god,” she said, on the sight of him - she had come to see where he’d fallen. “Doctor, it’s spreading. I think it’s blocked the exits and it’s working on the windows,” she lifted an axe onto her shoulder; she’d broken the emergency glass and grabbed a hold of it, though that was not what those axes were generally used for. She used it, now, to behead one vine which had dared to curl around her ankle. “But Barry says he’s got the systems back up.” 

“The systems?” he repeated, absently. 

“Doctor?” 

“Oh, Sarah, you are brilliant!” he snapped out of it in an instant, and the hand was completely forgotten.

SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA SONTAR-HA

summary: I think I know why I'm disappointed with the teaser. Cos I make a lot of photo manips, and I was hoping for some more footage I...
body: I think I know why I’m disappointed with the teaser. Cos I make a lot of photo manips, and I was hoping for some more footage I could use of 13. Buuuut, we’ve already got footage of her smiling and looking toward the camera, so I still can’t. Aaah well
